segment.source: diskidlehistogram
segment.target: diskidlehistogram

segment.source: diskidlehistogram
segment.target: diskidlehistogram

segment.source: diskidlehistogram
segment.target: diskidlehistogram

segment.source: This action produces a histogram that displays all disk activity and idle time.
segment.target: This action produces a histogram that displays all disk activity and idle time.

segment.source: Options
segment.target: Options

segment.source: n indicates the disk number (0-based disk index).
segment.target: n indicates the disk number (0-based disk index).

segment.source: The default value is to output histograms for all disks.
segment.target: The default value is to output histograms for all disks.

segment.source: Arguments indicate different ranges of idle length, in seconds.
segment.target: Arguments indicate different ranges of idle length, in seconds.

segment.source: Default buckets are as follows:
segment.target: Default buckets are as follows:

segment.source: 0 s, 1 s
segment.target: 0 s, 1 s

segment.source: 1 s, 5 s
segment.target: 1 s, 5 s

segment.source: 1800 s, +inf
segment.target: 1800 s, +inf

segment.source: A disk idle histogram displays the distribution of disk idle time and the number of idle periods over different ranges of idle period length, as illustrated by the example values in the following table.
segment.target: A disk idle histogram displays the distribution of disk idle time and the number of idle periods over different ranges of idle period length, as illustrated by the example values in the following table.

segment.source: Less than 1 second
segment.target: Less than 1 second

segment.source: 1-600 seconds
segment.target: 1-600 seconds

segment.source: More than 600 seconds
segment.target: More than 600 seconds

segment.source: Idle time
segment.target: Idle time

segment.source: Percent of total idle time
segment.target: Percent of total idle time

segment.source: Idle count
segment.target: Idle count

segment.source: Percent of total idle count
segment.target: Percent of total idle count

segment.source: The first row shows the histogram’s buckets: different ranges of idle length.
segment.target: The first row shows the histogram’s buckets: different ranges of idle length.

segment.source: The second row shows the accumulated idle time for each bucket.
segment.target: The second row shows the accumulated idle time for each bucket.

segment.source: For example, the accumulated idle time for all idle periods shorter than 1 second is 1000 seconds.
segment.target: For example, the accumulated idle time for all idle periods shorter than 1 second is 1000 seconds.

segment.source: The third row calculates the percentage of idle time for each bucket by dividing the idle time for a bucket by the total idle time.
segment.target: The third row calculates the percentage of idle time for each bucket by dividing the idle time for a bucket by the total idle time.

segment.source: The fourth row is the count of idle periods captured for each bucket.
segment.target: The fourth row is the count of idle periods captured for each bucket.

segment.source: In this example, there are 90 idle periods lasting less than one second.
segment.target: In this example, there are 90 idle periods lasting less than one second.

segment.source: The last row calculates the percentage of idle periods for each bucket by dividing the number of idle periods for a bucket by the total number of idle periods.
segment.target: The last row calculates the percentage of idle periods for each bucket by dividing the number of idle periods for a bucket by the total number of idle periods.

segment.source: The follow command would produce the buckets in the following list: -buckets 1s 5s 60s 180s:
segment.target: The follow command would produce the buckets in the following list: -buckets 1s 5s 60s 180s:

segment.source: 1 s, 5 s
segment.target: 1 s, 5 s

segment.source: 180 s, +inf
segment.target: 180 s, +inf

segment.source: Arguments indicate the idle timeout, in seconds.
segment.target: Arguments indicate the idle timeout, in seconds.

segment.source: The default values are 5, 60, 180, 600, and 1800.
segment.target: The default values are 5, 60, 180, 600, and 1800.

segment.source: Arguments indicate the idle threshold, in seconds.
segment.target: Arguments indicate the idle threshold, in seconds.

segment.source: Idle periods shorter than this threshold are ignored.
segment.target: Idle periods shorter than this threshold are ignored.

segment.source: If you do not specify an argument, the default value is 0.
segment.target: If you do not specify an argument, the default value is 0.

segment.source: Using a sequence of disk I/O timestamps and a specified idle timeout, you can compute when the disk would be spun down and how much time it can stay in spun-down state, as illustrated in the following table.
segment.target: Using a sequence of disk I/O timestamps and a specified idle timeout, you can compute when the disk would be spun down and how much time it can stay in spun-down state, as illustrated in the following table.

segment.source: Timeout, in seconds
segment.target: Timeout, in seconds

segment.source: Estimated spindown opportunity time, in seconds
segment.target: Estimated spindown opportunity time, in seconds

segment.source: Estimated spindown opportunity count
segment.target: Estimated spindown opportunity count

segment.source: The first row shows the idle timeout values of interest for estimating spun-down time.
segment.target: The first row shows the idle timeout values of interest for estimating spun-down time.

segment.source: The second row shows the estimated total spun-down time corresponding to each timeout.
segment.target: The second row shows the estimated total spun-down time corresponding to each timeout.

segment.source: In this example, a timeout of 5 seconds yielded the total spun-down time of 3800 seconds.
segment.target: In this example, a timeout of 5 seconds yielded the total spun-down time of 3800 seconds.

segment.source: The third row shows the estimated number of times the disk is spun down for each timeout value.
segment.target: The third row shows the estimated number of times the disk is spun down for each timeout value.

segment.source: If you do not specify an argument, the default value is 0 seconds.
segment.target: If you do not specify an argument, the default value is 0 seconds.

segment.source: Files matching the provided full file paths are excluded.
segment.target: Files matching the provided full file paths are excluded.

segment.source: You must specify the full file path for each file you want to exclude.
segment.target: You must specify the full file path for each file you want to exclude.

segment.source: Files containing one or more of the provided strings are excluded.
segment.target: Files containing one or more of the provided strings are excluded.

segment.source: Files matching the provided ATL regular expression are excluded.
segment.target: Files matching the provided ATL regular expression are excluded.

segment.source: For example, you can ignore all files ending with .dll by specifying the expression "..dll".
segment.target: For example, you can ignore all files ending with .dll by specifying the expression "..dll".

segment.source: Note When defining a new line, you must include a return character.
segment.target: Note When defining a new line, you must include a return character.

segment.source: Instead of using n, use rn.
segment.target: Instead of using n, use rn.

segment.source: By including both characters (carriage return = r; line feed = n), you create a line terminator.
segment.target: By including both characters (carriage return = r; line feed = n), you create a line terminator.

segment.source: This is helpful when creating a regions of interest file.
segment.target: This is helpful when creating a regions of interest file.

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: There are a few system files whose disk I/Os are in response to disk I/Os to other files.
segment.target: There are a few system files whose disk I/Os are in response to disk I/Os to other files.

segment.source: These system files include the following:
segment.target: These system files include the following:

segment.source: $LogFiles
segment.target: $LogFiles

segment.source: $Mft
segment.target: $Mft

segment.source: $Bitmap
segment.target: $Bitmap

segment.source: lastalive0.dat
segment.target: lastalive0.dat

segment.source: lastalive1.dat
segment.target: lastalive1.dat

segment.source: $UsnJrnl:$J
segment.target: $UsnJrnl:$J

segment.source: It can be difficult to differentiate which disk I/Os to other files cause a particular disk I/O to the above system files.
segment.target: It can be difficult to differentiate which disk I/Os to other files cause a particular disk I/O to the above system files.

segment.source: Consequently, if you want to see the impact of the files that you have excluded, you must also exclude these system files.
segment.target: Consequently, if you want to see the impact of the files that you have excluded, you must also exclude these system files.

segment.source: Because these system files’ disk I/Os are in response to or "piggyback" on other disk I/Os, ignoring only these system files themselves is not expected to change the disk idle histogram significantly.
segment.target: Because these system files’ disk I/Os are in response to or "piggyback" on other disk I/Os, ignoring only these system files themselves is not expected to change the disk idle histogram significantly.

segment.source: Output from this action can be imported into a spreadsheet for sorting and analysis.
segment.target: Output from this action can be imported into a spreadsheet for sorting and analysis.

segment.source: Two additional metrics are provided for the output:
segment.target: Two additional metrics are provided for the output:

segment.source: AvgIOInterval
segment.target: AvgIOInterval

segment.source: For a particular file, this is the average interval between two subsequent I/Os to this file.
segment.target: For a particular file, this is the average interval between two subsequent I/Os to this file.

segment.source: This metric can be misleading if a file has tiny I/O intervals, such as intervals of less than 1 second.
segment.target: This metric can be misleading if a file has tiny I/O intervals, such as intervals of less than 1 second.

segment.source: Even if this file also has large I/O intervals, such as 30 minutes, the average IO interval may look much worse than another file with medium short I/O intervals, such as 10 minutes.
segment.target: Even if this file also has large I/O intervals, such as 30 minutes, the average IO interval may look much worse than another file with medium short I/O intervals, such as 10 minutes.

segment.source: In this case, you could use to remove idle periods of less than 1 second from the analysis.
segment.target: In this case, you could use to remove idle periods of less than 1 second from the analysis.

segment.source: MaxIOInterval
segment.target: MaxIOInterval

segment.source: For each file, this is the maximum interval between two subsequent I/Os to this file.
segment.target: For each file, this is the maximum interval between two subsequent I/Os to this file.

segment.source: The output is sorted based on this metric by default.
segment.target: The output is sorted based on this metric by default.

segment.source: A file with one large I/O interval can still have frequent I/Os on average.
segment.target: A file with one large I/O interval can still have frequent I/Os on average.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Use both of these metrics and per-file histograms for a comprehensive picture of disk activity.
segment.target: Use both of these metrics and per-file histograms for a comprehensive picture of disk activity.

segment.source: Avoid perturbing the disk(s) under study by using a different physical disk (or device such as a USB flash drive) to collect the trace.
segment.target: Avoid perturbing the disk(s) under study by using a different physical disk (or device such as a USB flash drive) to collect the trace.

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: The following example shows a typical use of this action with default parameters
segment.target: The following example shows a typical use of this action with default parameters

segment.source: Collect information on disk I/Os as well as related information, such as registry/cswitch/stacks, in case deeper analysis is needed.
segment.target: Collect information on disk I/Os as well as related information, such as registry/cswitch/stacks, in case deeper analysis is needed.

segment.source: can be used to reduce trace file size.
segment.target: can be used to reduce trace file size.

segment.source: The following example shows a set of recommended Xperf flags.
segment.target: The following example shows a set of recommended Xperf flags.

segment.target: Related topics
